posts.post_content:
Ugh...  
This card.  
So, hear me out.  
I love it. It's really good in a dedicated Evolve deck.  
I love the card draw, I love how beefy it gets, I love the small little interactions with all the cool stuff...  
That being said...  
It REALLY hurts using that T4 for something that won't trigger your Evolve creatures or put something with an already good P/T ratio.  
I give it a 4.5, because honestly, that downside is hardly anything after you start getting that card advantage.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Here is your guide to draw your deck thousands of times over.  
Step 1: Play [Master Biomancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Biomancer)  
Step 2: Play[Corpsejack Menace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpsejack Menace) has 2 +1/+1 counters  
Step 3: Play another[Corpsejack Menace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpsejack Menace) has 4 +1/+1 counters  
Step 4: Play yet another [Corpsejack Menace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpsejack Menace) has 8 +1/+1 counters  
Step 5: Yet another [Corpsejack Menace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpsejack Menace) has 16 +1/+1 counters  
At this point, any number of counters that would be placed on a creature you control is multiplied by 16.  
Step 6: [Master Biomancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Biomancer) has 32 +1/+1 counters  
Total Biomancer power: 36  
Step 7: [Master Biomancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Biomancer) has 576 +1/+1 counters  
Total Biomancer power: 614  
Step 8: [Master Biomancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Biomancer) has 9,824 +1/+1 counters  
Total Biomancer power: 10,440  
Step 9: [Fathom Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fathom Mage). It will enter with 167,040 +1/+1 counters. Enjoy :D  
Please note, totally hypothetical. With any type of clone ([Evil Twin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evil Twin)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
The fact that this card is potentially one of the most powerful and versatile draw engines/beaters easily makes up for it being a turn four 1/1. Ok, so you take a gamble playing it in the current meta, but that's the meta's fault. Wizards should print *more*  cards like this, not less.  
5/5.
